summary: This document is a list of materials produced to the defense in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It is a detailed index of evidence, including police reports, FBI intake reports, interview transcripts (302s), victim lists, and correspondence, primarily from the 2006-2007 Palm Beach Police Department investigation and subsequent FBI investigations into Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: This is a discovery index listing hundreds of evidence items produced to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team in November 2021.
The evidence spans from 2004 to 2021, covering the initial Palm Beach Police investigation (2006-2007) and the subsequent federal investigations.
A significant portion of the list consists of numerous anonymous FBI intake reports from mid-2019, suggesting a large volume of public tips.
The list includes extensive records on several key witnesses, such as Janusz Banasiak, who was interviewed multiple times and gave depositions.
The document is subject to a protective order, restricting the disclosure of certain sensitive materials.
